  • iris.pipelines.data_science package

iris.pipelines.data_science package¶

Example code for the nodes in the example pipeline. This code is meant just for illustrating basic Kedro features.

PLEASE DELETE THIS FILE ONCE YOU START WORKING ON YOUR OWN PROJECT!

Submodules¶

iris.pipelines.data_science.nodes module¶

Example code for the nodes in the example pipeline. This code is meant just for illustrating basic Kedro features.

Delete this when you start working on your own Kedro project.

iris.pipelines.data_science.nodes.predict(model, test_x)[source]¶

Node for making predictions given a pre-trained model and a test set.

Return type

ndarray

iris.pipelines.data_science.nodes.report_accuracy(predictions, test_y)[source]¶

Node for reporting the accuracy of the predictions performed by the previous node. Notice that this function has no outputs, except logging.

Return type

None

iris.pipelines.data_science.nodes.train_model(train_x, train_y, parameters)[source]¶

Node for training a simple multi-class logistic regression model. The number of training iterations as well as the learning rate are taken from conf/project/parameters.yml. All of the data as well as the parameters will be provided to this function at the time of execution.

Return type

ndarray

iris.pipelines.data_science.pipeline module¶

Example code for the nodes in the example pipeline. This code is meant just for illustrating basic Kedro features.

Delete this when you start working on your own Kedro project.

iris.pipelines.data_science.pipeline.create_pipeline(**kwargs)[source]¶
